metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12427 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: The ProcessMSLScript function in coders/msl.c in ImageMagick before 6.9.9-5 and 7.x before 7.0.6-5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory leak) via a crafted file, related to the WriteMSLImage function.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 0141-Memory-leaks-in-WriteMSLImage.patch in unstable 0263-CVE-2017-12427-Fix-remote-denial-of-service-memory-leak-in-WriteMSLImage.patch in wheezy not fixing memory leak in trusty and xenial

criterions.comment: imagemagick: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
